episodeTitle: A Shocking Fact! The True Identity of Hordy!
description: Fukaboshi broadcasts the shocking truth about Hody Jones to all of Fish-Man Island: when asked what humans did to him, Hody answered 'Nothing.' Meanwhile, Robin defeats Hammond and frees enslaved humans, Sanji and Jinbe battle Wadatsumi in his massive Mega Monk form, and the Noah begins falling toward the island again.

events.title: Hody's 'Nothing' Revelation
events.description: Through Fukaboshi's broadcast, the shocking truth about Hody Jones is revealed to all of Fish-Man Island. When asked what humans did to him to cause his hatred, Hody answered 'Nothing.' He has never personally been wronged by humans - his hatred is inherited and environmentally learned from the Fish-Man District.
events.significance: This reveals the core theme of the Fish-Man Island arc: generational hatred and prejudice passed down without personal experience. Hody represents pure, baseless hatred born from an environment of resentment, making him a 'monster born from their environment' as Luffy describes.

quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: When Fukaboshi asked what humans did to him to make him hate them so much

quotes.text: He's a monster born from their environment.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's description of Hody after learning the truth

events.title: Wadatsumi's Mega Monk Form
events.description: Wadatsumi transforms into his Mega Nyudo (Mega Monk) form by inhaling massive amounts of air and expanding his body to enormous proportions. In his anger at being goaded by Sanji, he crushes many of his own allies unknowingly.
events.significance: Demonstrates Wadatsumi's powerful but indiscriminate fighting technique during the battle at Gyoncorde Plaza. Shows how Sanji can use psychological tactics in combat.

events.title: Robin Defeats Hammond
events.description: Nico Robin uses her new post-timeskip technique 'Doble Clutch' to defeat Hammond, destroying his slave tank and freeing the enslaved humans inside. The freed humans then revolt against the New Fish-Man Pirates.
events.significance: Showcases Robin's improved abilities after the two-year timeskip. The liberation of slaves leads to them joining the fight against the New Fish-Man Pirates, shifting the battle's momentum.

events.title: Neptune Army Officially Joins the Straw Hats
events.description: The Minister of the Right and Neptune Army troops arrive at Gyoncorde Plaza. Acknowledging their previous errors in judgment, they officially decide to back up the Straw Hat Pirates in battle, stating that the country's honor would be shattered if they were backed up solely by pirates.
events.significance: Represents a turning point where Fish-Man Island's government officially allies with the Straw Hats, showing trust and changing allegiances during the crisis.

quotes.text: The country's honor would be shattered if we were backed up solely by a gang of pirates.
quotes.speaker: Minister of the Right
quotes.context: Ordering the Neptune Army to join the Straw Hats

events.title: Noah's Prophetic Significance Hinted
events.description: As Noah begins falling toward Fish-Man Island again, Neptune cryptically mentions 'if Noah hits the island, it would be just as it was written,' hinting at ancient prophecies or knowledge about the ship's significance.
events.significance: Foreshadows the deeper historical and prophetic importance of Noah, connecting to Joy Boy, the Ancient Kingdom, and the eventual need to bring Fish-Men to the surface world.

quotes.text: If Noah hits the island, it would be just as it was written.
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Commenting on Noah's approach to the island

events.title: Fukaboshi's Broadcast Reveals New Fish-Man Pirates' True Nature
events.description: Fukaboshi's broadcast explains that the New Fish-Man Pirates are empty beings who thrive on hatred without substance. They perpetuate animosity because they fear their hatred toward humans will fade, wanting humans to remain evil to justify their actions rather than seeking genuine peace for Fish-Men.
events.significance: Exposes the ideological emptiness of the antagonists and establishes the arc's central theme about the cyclical nature of inherited hatred and prejudice.

events.title: Hody Charges at Luffy and Shirahoshi
events.description: Following the revelation of his true nature being broadcast across Fish-Man Island, Hody charges maniacally at Luffy and Shirahoshi, driven by rage at having his emptiness exposed.
events.significance: Sets up the continuation of the battle between Luffy and Hody, now with the truth about Hody's motivations revealed to everyone.

quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody's response when asked what humans did to him

quotes.text: He's a monster born from their environment.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's description of Hody Jones after the truth is revealed

quotes.text: If Noah hits the island, it would be just as it was written.
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Neptune's cryptic comment about Noah's prophetic significance

quotes.text: The country's honor would be shattered if we were backed up solely by a gang of pirates.
quotes.speaker: Minister of the Right
quotes.context: Ordering the Neptune Army to support the Straw Hats

themes.description: The episode's central revelation about Hody having 'nothing' done to him by humans exposes how hatred can be passed down through generations without personal experience or rational foundation.
themes.symbolism: Hody represents the dangerous cycle of inherited prejudice - he is literally a monster created by an environment of resentment in the Fish-Man District, perpetuating hatred he never personally experienced.
culturalReferences: Cycles of generational trauma and prejudice
The dangers of echo chambers that reinforce hatred

themes.description: The episode explores how environment shapes individuals, particularly those raised in poverty and resentment like the Fish-Man District, while also questioning whether this absolves personal responsibility.
themes.symbolism: The Fish-Man District as a breeding ground for hatred contrasts with characters like Jinbe who chose a different path despite similar origins.

themes.description: The enslaved humans breaking free and joining the fight represents the power of liberation to shift the tide of battle and justice.
themes.symbolism: Robin freeing the slaves parallels the broader theme of breaking chains - both literal slavery and the metaphorical chains of inherited hatred.

characterSpotlights.development: The shocking truth about Hody is revealed - his hatred of humans has no personal foundation. He answered 'Nothing' when asked what humans did to him, exposing him as an empty vessel of inherited prejudice rather than someone with justified grievances.
keyActions: His past conversation with Fukaboshi is revealed in flashback
Charges maniacally at Luffy and Shirahoshi after his truth is broadcast

characterSpotlights.development: Takes the initiative to broadcast the truth about Hody to all of Fish-Man Island, exposing the New Fish-Man Pirates as monsters born from their environment who perpetuate hatred out of fear it will fade.
keyActions: Broadcasts the shocking truth about Hody's 'Nothing' response
Explains the true nature of the New Fish-Man Pirates to the island

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates her post-timeskip combat abilities and tactical thinking by defeating Hammond and freeing enslaved humans.
keyActions: Uses Doble Clutch technique to defeat Hammond
Destroys the slave tank and liberates the captive humans
Helps shift the momentum of the battle

characterSpotlights.development: Continues battling Wadatsumi using psychological tactics, goading him into becoming larger and more dangerous but also less controlled.
keyActions: Goads Wadatsumi into expanding to Mega Monk form

characterSpotlights.development: Learns the truth about Hody and succinctly describes him as 'a monster born from their environment,' showing his understanding of the situation's complexity.
keyActions: Listens to Fukaboshi's revelation about Hody
Accurately describes Hody's nature to Shirahoshi
quotes: He's a monster born from their environment.

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode contains the most manga page coverage since Episode 524, adapting portions of chapters 642-644.
Minor animation inconsistency: Hammond briefly wears loafers instead of his usual sandals in some frames.
Zeo's chains are shown for the first time in the anime, a visual detail from the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 563 contains the most manga page coverage since Episode 524, making it one of the most efficiently paced episodes in the Fish-Man Island arc.
The 'Nothing' revelation is considered one of the most thematically significant moments in One Piece, as it addresses real-world issues of inherited prejudice and generational hatred.
Hody Jones is voiced by Joji Nakata in Japanese, who is well-known for voicing villains and morally complex characters including Kirei Kotomine in Fate/stay night and Alucard in Hellsing.
Robin's 'Doble Clutch' technique name uses Spanish spelling rather than English 'Double,' consistent with Robin's Devil Fruit techniques often using Spanish names (Fleur, Mano, etc.).
The episode aired on September 9, 2012 in Japan, during the arc that marked the Straw Hats' reunion after the two-year timeskip.
